body:
Hello @albertalbesa , thanks a lot for raising this issue.

First, could you let me know whether:
1. You run the application locally on a desktop machine, i.e., with a monitor connected to it
2. You run the application on a remote (headless) server and want to use X forwarding

Assuming that the answer is (1), to better understand your system setup, could you provide the outputs of running the following commands:

``` bash
cat /etc/gdm3/custom.conf | grep WaylandEnable
echo $XDG_SESSION_TYPE
echo $DISPLAY
```

Thanks a lot!

/Steffen

rename.from: Installing deeplabcut-docker on ubuntu20 - Failed to launch the DLC GUI
rename.to: Installing deeplabcut-docker on ubuntu20 - Failed to launch the DLC GUI; `as 'headless' is currently running`

body: Also running into the same issue :( export light doesn't solve the problem.

Hello @heejaeyunajang , could you please also provide some info regarding my questions above, and let me know the outputs of the three commands I posted?

Thanks a lot!

Hi @stes !

Thank you for the support. By the time of your response I had already solved it by following the steps in 

https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/recipes/installTips.html#installation-on-ubuntu-20-04-lts

for the drivers installation and then used Docker. Do you think there is some test I can run that might be useful to isolate the issue without uninstalling DLC? If so I will be happy to do it.  

@heejaeyunajang you might also want to try if that works for you
hey @albertalbesa could you just clarify what the solution was / if you don't mind answering @stes questions, it would be helpful for us.

issue.title: WXAgg error in Docker

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description
I've tried both: creating a conda env or using docker to import deeplabcut containers.
In both cases, the installation goes through. But when I run

$ python -m deeplabcut
-or-
$ deeplabcut-docker gui

I get very similar errors involving WXAgg. Not sure how to solve this.
#3 shows you the gpu information.

### Operating System

Ubuntu 20.04.2

### DeepLabCut version

### DeepLabCut mode

### Device type

14 VCPUs and 1 GPU

### Steps To Reproduce

### Relevant log output

```shell
>#1

(DEEPLABCUT) jkrhee@compute:~/anaconda3/envs$ python -m deeplabcut

To enable them in other operations, rebuild TensorFlow with the appropriate compiler flags.
2022-10-07 09:41:07.267372: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_blas.cc:2981] Unable to register cuBLAS factory: Attempting to register factory for plugin cuBLAS when one has already been registered
2022-10-07 09:41:13.538786: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'libnvinfer.so.7'; dlerror: libnvinfer.so.7: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

2022-10-07 09:41:13.538999: W tensorflow/compiler/tf2tensorrt/utils/py_utils.cc:38] TF-TRT Warning: Cannot dlopen some TensorRT libraries. If you would like to use Nvidia GPU with TensorRT, please make sure the missing libraries mentioned above are installed properly.

  File "/nfs/home/jkrhee/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/runpy.py", line 87, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
```
